General component definitions: Hydrologic data (timeseries). Typically representing multiple scenarios, e.g. climate and climate adaptations. May include other inputs as needed by response models.
Specific components used in our example: Modified historical hydrographs to represent hypothetical climate change and adaptations (45 gauges, 15 scenarios)
Details of Specific components: Daily flow rates for 45 for 36 scenarios

General component definitions: Interface between input data, response model, and other toolkit components. Sets up run(s).
Specific components used in our example: Sets up links to data and parameters for EWR tool and aggregations.

General component definitions: A model of the response of values, e.g.  social, cultural, environmental, or economic values in response to hydrologic drivers.
Details of Specific components: The EWR tool holds databases of the EWRs required to meet the environmental objectives of the basin, which protect or enhance environmental assets that are valued based on ecological significance.

General component definitions: Aggregates response model results to scales across the dimensions of time, space, and theme.
Specific components used in our example: Response model sets the base scale for aggregation. EWR tool assesses hydrologic indicators (value) at gauges (space) and year (time).
Details of Specific components: The spatial dimension consists of gauges nested within planning units within the basin. The time dimension assessess EWR performance averaged over the yearly data returned by the EWR tool. The value dimension consists of multiple EWRs (hydrologic indicators) that apply to environmental values (many-to-many), at multiple levels in the causal network (e.g. life-cycle components, species, groups of species, or long-term planning targets).

General component definitions: Compares scenarios (typically) or other groupings. Provides standard outputs including comparison methods, plots, and tables.
Specific components used in our example: Comparison of environmental values at various theme scales for the example climate and adaptation scenarios
Details of Specific components: Explored in detail in figures and tables
Provided by HydroBOT. LTWP required of Basin States by the Murray-Darling Basin Plan and give effect to the Basin-wide Environmental Watering Strategy.

Specific components used in our example: Gauge locations, Sustainable Diversion Limits (SDL) units, Murray-Darling Basin
Details of Specific components: Sourced from MDBA, representing the gauges at which EWRs are assessed and the spatial units for many management needs, provided by HydroBOT as sf objects.
